events.body: I'll squash later if I get ACKs

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
No conflicts as of last run.

> I'll squash later if I get ACKs

Generally people only ACK things that are in a state where they could be merged, so it is preferable for PRs to be squashed (and rebased if needed) before seeking ACKs,
Maybe close for now and reopen when it is ready? This is a one-line doc change, so doesn't seem worth it to sit several months?
I guess this could be something unexpected from the point of view of a user, unless I'm missing something here, maybe should be specified as a warning? (e.g. "be aware of...")
Simple but nice addition to the documentation. @Rspigler any plans of squashing this so it can be merged ?
Closing for now. @Rspigler please comment and this can be re-opened, after which you can squash the commits (pushing to the branch of a closed PR will break GitHub). @Sjors maybe you can also review?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -39,6 +39,7 @@ Create a wallet, this automatically imports the public keys:
 ```sh
 $ bitcoin-cli createwallet "hww" true true "" true true true
 ```
+Creating `N` distinctly named wallets with the same external signer, will create `N` identical wallets, with the same seed, account, and addresses - just named differently. New wallet creation will not automatically increment the `account` path.
comments.body: Not identical, since metadata can(will?) differ
